citations.narrative:
Two dogs Daryl (MC#23935) and Max (MC#74040) had been in a fight the morning of the inspection. Neither dog was
injured, but they were still housed together in the same enclosure. Dogs housed in the same enclosure must be
compatible. Displays of aggression between co-housed dogs require appropriate intervention by the facility. These dogs
must be separated and evaluated by the facility to determine their future disposition. This non-compliance was corrected
during the inspection by separating the dogs.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.6(c)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two dogs Daryl (MC#23935) and Max (MC#74040) had been in a fight the morning of the inspection. Neither dog was 
injured, but they were still housed together in the same enclosure. Dogs housed in the same enclosure must be 
compatible. Displays of aggression between co-housed dogs require appropriate intervention by the facility. These dogs 
must be separated and evaluated by the facility to determine their future disposition. This non-compliance was corrected 
during the inspection by separating the dogs. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n
